it.eng.qbe.datasource.configuration
Interface IDataSourceConfiguration

All Known Implementing Classes:
CompositeDataSourceConfiguration, FileDataSourceConfiguration
public interface IDataSourceConfiguration

Classes that implement this interface act as a proxy toward all the resources needed in order to create a new IDataSource. All the methods in these class do not cache managed resources so calling them can involve an heavy overhead due to IO. It's up to the caller to implement the proper caching system in order to minimize the use of this interface.

Author:
Andrea Gioia (andrea.gioia@eng.it)

Method Detail

getModelName

java.lang.String getModelName()
Returns:
the name of the model. Must be unique. It is used as model identifier (ex. while caching model)

loadModelProperties

IModelProperties loadModelProperties()
Load the properties associated to the model. These properties are usually injected into the model by a proper implementation of interface IModelPropertiesInitializer. NOTE: model properties can be only read. It is not possible to change them and persist the modification

Returns:
the properties associated to the model.

loadModelI18NProperties

IModelProperties loadModelI18NProperties()
Facility method. It is equivalent to loadModelI18NProperties(null)

Returns:
the i18n properties associated to the model for the given locale

loadModelI18NProperties

IModelProperties loadModelI18NProperties(java.util.Locale locale)
Load the properties associated to the model that are dependant to the locale (i.e. labels, tooltips). These properties are not injected into the model because the same datasource can be used at the same time by different objects with different locales. Beacuse a datasource can consume a big amount of resources (i.e. heap space) is not praticable to create different instances of the same datasource for any available locale.

Parameters:
locale - The desired locale. If null load the default properties (i.e. label.properties)
Returns:
the i18n properties associated to the model for the given locale

loadDataSourceProperties

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> loadDataSourceProperties()
Returns:
the properties associated to the specific data source type. The numeber and type of these properties depend on the DataSource implementation
